title: Beforehand Cushioning
intent: Absorb shocks and uncertainty by building safety buffers into the system before failures occur.

triz_principle.name: Beforehand Cushioning
triz_principle.definition: Prepare emergency measures or safety margins in advance to compensate for low reliability or uncertainty.

problem_understanding.core_contradiction: We want efficiency and speed, but reality is unpredictable and failures are inevitable.
problem_understanding.why_this_hurts: Systems optimized only for the happy path collapse under stress, causing outages, delays, and panic reactions.
typical_signals: no slack in timelines or capacity

solution_logic.core_idea: Introduce buffers that absorb variability without stopping the system.
solution_logic.key_rule: Buffer where uncertainty is highest, not everywhere.
solution_logic.how_it_resolves_the_contradiction: The system stays fast in normal conditions while remaining resilient under stress.

consulting: fallback decision paths if consensus fails
software_engineering: graceful degradation instead of hard failure
feature flags to disable risky functionality quickly
enterprise_sap: staging buffers before mass data loads

anti_patterns: using buffers to hide poor design
buffers with no ownership or monitoring
diagnostic_questions: Where would failure hurt the most?
What minimal buffer would prevent cascading damage?

example.before: A single failed step blocks the entire release or data load.
example.after: Failures are isolated, buffered, and recovered without stopping the whole system.
